page.title: 14OCKBROOK& BORROWASH CARNIVAL
page.content: The Carnival took place on Saturday 6th July 1985.This was the first Carnival for two years and its aim was to{involve}the community and make money for the{Derby Scanner Appeal}and {Borrowash Gateway Club.}The Parade left Pares Way,Ockbrook and marched to Deans Drive Playing Field,Borrowash. The parade featured six floats including the winning decorated float "The Professionals" entered by the residents of Kimberley Road.The Carnival waS opened by the {Mayor of {Erewash}Councillor Peter Cresswell and the programme included the presentation of prizes,a dog obedience display,a display by the Boys'Brigade and the {C.B.S.L. Carnival Band {Contest}featuring the host band {The {Ambassadors of Borrowash.}The trophies were presented by the Carnival Queen Miss Sara Rollerson.
